message.content: One of the most significant events that happened in Portugal in the past 100 years is the Carnation Revolution, also known as the 25th of April Revolution. It occurred on April 25, 1974, and marked the end of the authoritarian Estado Novo regime that had been in power for nearly 48 years under António de Oliveira Salazar and Marcelo Caetano. The revolution was a peaceful military coup led by the Armed Forces Movement, and it resulted in the establishment of a democratic government in Portugal. This event had a profound impact on the country, leading to political, social, and economic changes, including the decolonization of Portuguese territories and the transition to democracy.
